item.title: [SS-1075] Startup consistency failures
item.description: We have 5 errors that show up when we start the server. The errors are below. Failure #1: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Verify datetime orderings between OrigEffectiveDate and EffectiveDate Failure #2: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Verify datetime orderings between EffectiveDate and ExpirationDate Failure #3: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Verify datetime orderings between EffectiveDate and ExpirationDate Failure #4: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Verify join table consistency between cc_coverage and cc_policyvehicle Failure #5: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Check that denormalized claimant matches claimant on the claim
item.comment: From: Mark Poulsen [mailto:mark_poulsen@uhaul.com] Sent: Thursday, December 07, 2006 14:23 To: Paul Schaaf Cc: Logan Barnett; Abram Bachtiar WARN Failure #1: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Verify datetime orderings between OrigEffectiveDate and EffectiveDate sql string = SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cc_policy WHERE NOT OrigEffectiveDate <= EffectiveDate number of inconsistencies found = 5 description of failure = Query expected to return 0 rows.   WARN Failure #2: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Verify datetime orderings between EffectiveDate and ExpirationDate sql string = SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cc_policy WHERE NOT EffectiveDate <= ExpirationDate number of inconsistencies found = 18 description of failure = Query expected to return 0 rows. WARN Failure #3: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Verify datetime orderings between EffectiveDate and ExpirationDate sql string = SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cc_coverage WHERE NOT EffectiveDate <= ExpirationDate number of inconsistencies found = 11 description of failure = Query expected to return 0 rows.   WARN Failure #4: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Verify join table consistency between cc_coverage and cc_policyvehicle sql string = SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cc_coverage WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM cc_policyvehicle WHERE cc_coverage.PolicyID = cc_policyvehicle.PolicyID AND cc_coverage.VehicleID = cc_policyvehicle.VehicleID) AND cc_coverage.PolicyID IS NOT NULL AND cc_coverage.VehicleID IS NOT NULL number of inconsistencies found = 1 description of failure = Query expected to return 0 rows.   WARN Failure #5: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Check that denormalized claimant matches claimant on the claim sql string = SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT cc_claim.id FROM cc_claim WHERE cc_claim.retired = 0 AND cc_claim.ClaimantDenormID IS NULL AND EXISTS( SELECT cc.ContactID FROM cc_claimcontact cc, cc_claimcontactrole ccr WHERE ccr.ClaimContactID = cc.id AND ccr.Active = 1 AND ccr.Role = 1 AND cc.retired = 0 AND ccr.retired = 0 AND cc.ClaimID = cc_claim.id AND ccr.EvaluationID IS NULL AND ccr.ExposureID IS NULL AND ccr.MatterID IS NULL AND ccr.NegotiationID IS NULL AND ccr.PolicyID IS NULL )) a number of inconsistencies found = 1 description of failure = Query expected to return 0 rows.   WARN Failure #6: check type = 0 description of consistency check = Incorrect value for check gross amount of check in CheckGroup. sql string = SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (SELECT GroupID FROM (SELECT c.GroupID AS GroupID, SUM(tli.Amount) AS Amount FROM cc_transaction t, cc_transactionlineitem tli, cc_check c WHERE t.retired=0 AND tli.retired=0 AND t.subtype=1 AND tli.TransactionID=t.id AND t.CheckID=c.id AND c.GroupID IS NOT NULL GROUP BY c.GroupID UNION ALL SELECT cg.id AS GroupID, -SUM(r.GrossAmount) AS Amount FROM cc_checkrpt r, cc_check c, cc_checkgroup cg WHERE c.retired=0 AND cg.retired=0 AND r.CheckID=c.id AND c.GroupID=cg.id AND c.Status NOT IN (10, 19, 8, 15) GROUP BY cg.id) DERIVEDTBL GROUP BY GroupID HAVING SUM(Amount) <> 0) a number of inconsistencies found = 1 description of failure = Query expected to return 0 rows.
item.current-status: Check with Vin re: denormalized claimants as he recently had a similar issue. The datetime orderings may be fixable with an SQL update, see Engineering. I (Paul) worked with Jerry on a similar issue a few months back.

item.title: [SS-1105] Need to eliminate duplicate contact who is already issued a check
item.description: From: Mark Poulsen [mailto:mark_poulsen@uhaul.com] Sent: Wednesday, January 03, 2007 9:01 AM To: support Cc: Abram Bachtiar Subject: Merging Roles Hi Paul, We had an adjuster create two separate checks to the same vendor. The adjuster added the vendor twice to the Parties Invovled section and each contact was cut a check. I'm not exactly sure why the adjuster just didn't create the second check to the same vendor. Anyways, I've tried merging the two contacts to hopefully create one contact but I get the error message below. Is there a way to merge these contacts into one even though a check has already been created?   Mark Poulsen Programmer/Analyst U-Haul International, Inc (602) 263-6811 x3061
item.summary: Need to eliminate duplicate contact who is already issued a check

item.title: [FFS-3556] IE7 Document creation error: "The document that you specify is either empty or does not exist"
item.description: I upgraded my browser to IE7. I'm testing CIGA's configuration of CC 3.0.6 and I'm experiencing some weird behavior when creating new documents. Here's what's happening: - I navigate to a claim and create a document from a template - I search for a template, select it and click next - The document is generated just fine. I verified that it gets created in the folder: C:\Documents and Settings\twinter\Local Settings\Temp\Guidewire\radA2025.doc - I close Word and click next - The wizard page titled 'Link Document' appears. The textbox contains the wrong path to the file. Instead of the above path, it has "C:\Documet and Settings\twinter\Local Settings\Temp\Guidewire\radA2025.doc" (note that c:\Documents is missing an 'n' and 's') - When I finish the wizard it, it throws the error "The document that you specify is either empty or does not exist. Please enter the document again." Someone on the services team posted a note a while back saying if you upgrade to IE7, you'll need to delete your TemplateRunner.ScriptControl. I did that and tested this again and got the same error. I tried testing this against the sandbox 3.0.6 environment and did NOT get the error. When I tested this on a different CIGA environment, the path got messed up differently: "C:\Documents d Settings\twinter\Local Settings\Temp\Guidewire\rad51954.doc"
item.summary: IE7 Document creation error: "The document that you specify is either empty or does not exist"
item.comment: This path gets inserted through a call to SendKeys(), which mimics Windows keystroke events. It looks like some of the keystrokes are somehow getting dropped. Since the keystrokes which get dropped seem to vary, it may be a timing issue which is dependent on attributes of the particular client machine. I've seen one Google result which seems to imply that this is a known IE7 problem, but I can't find anything on MS's site. I'll look again.
item.current-status: Bryan Johnson is looking to see if this is a known IE7 issue.

item.title: [FFS-3645] SOAPExceptions while using IClaimFinancials.addClaimFinancialsWithValidation
item.description: I am using IClaimFinancialsAPI.addClaimFinancials to import checks into ClaimCenter. Occasionally I get a SOAP exception during import. This is a client side exception, where nothing is logged in the claimcenter log file. I have seen different exceptions, below is one example. I am wondering what causes these to occur. The exceptions do not occur consistently, even when the same checks are imported. In fact, they are moderately rare, occuring in perhaps 1/10000 times. If you can find out what the various causes of this might be, I would appreciate it. I am working around this by collecting the failed imports and resubmitting them, which is working so far, but if the errors increase, it would cause a problem. Here is the stack trace: electric.util.WrappedException: SOAPException( Server: java.io.IOException: java.lang.NullPointerException )         at electric.proxy.handler.Proxy.getCompatibleException(Unknown Source)         at electric.proxy.handler.Proxy.invoke(Unknown Source)         at electric.util.proxy.proxy3.InvocationAdaptor.invoke(Unknown Source)         at $Proxy1.addClaimFinancialsWithValidation(Unknown Source)         at com.ciga.cc.integration.billimport.logic.BillProcessor.addVendorCheck(BillProcessor.java:3368)         at com.ciga.cc.integration.billimport.logic.BillProcessor.access$200(BillProcessor.java:49)         at com.ciga.cc.integration.billimport.logic.BillProcessor$BRThread.run(BillProcessor.java:5070)         at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

item.title: [FFS-3522] cc 3.0 IDataObjectAPI.setPathValues problem (does not change null field to space)
item.description: I am using IDataObjectAPI.setPathValues to update a record in CC_CONTACT. If one of the fields on the contact is null, I need to set it to some value, so I am trying to set it to a single space. The call completes and seems to be successful (Other fields are changed appropriately) but the specified field is still null - it doesn't have a space. I can change my code to use a different character but I need to know if that is required. Ie, is this a known issue?
item.summary: cc 3.0 IDataObjectAPI.setPathValues problem (does not change null field to space)
item.comment: Gus/Jing, In 3.1, I see the following in config/metadata/dmbase.xsd <!--           Applies to text based data types. If true, leading and trailing whitespace           are removed. Default is true since whitespace trimming is desirable for most           textual columns         -->         <xsd:attribute name="trimwhitespace" type="xsd:boolean" default="true" /> Was this new in 3.1 ? And, not available earlier, say, in 3.0.6 ?

item.title: [SS-760] Poor performace approving payments on Claims with 1000+ transactions
item.description: Troy reports that on claims with large numbers (1,000--2,000) of transactions, it takes upwards of a minute to approve payments in production. Troy noticed many cache evictions so will increase the cache size, but as there are only a small number of users it's not clear that this is the problem. The same poor performance is not witnessed in the UAT system. This is affecting the product image--users fear how it will perform when new teams come online.
item.summary: Poor performace approving payments on Claims with 1000+ transactions
item.comment: It might be, though at the moment I'm still working on some fixes for obvious hot spots in the code. Once I get those done we can revisit whether we should try to test against CIGA's environment. Hopefully the CIGA DB might get us a valid copy of the DB before then.
item.current-status: Nothing for support to do on this at this time. To be addressed by financials performance fixes scheduled for 3.0.7 in January.

item.title: [SS-1102] Reserve transactions are stuck in 'Submitting' status
item.description: In CIGA's production environment, there are 58 reserve transactions that are stuck in submitting status. They have create dates spread over the past month. This was reported as being a problem by one of the users because we built a rule that prevents them from closing a claim that has transactions with 'submitting' & other statuses. I'm not sure if it's related or not, but the exposure the reserves are on has validation errors. Any thoughts on what could be wrong?
item.summary: Reserve transactions are stuck in 'Submitting' status
item.comment: Right, that's a critical clarification to my previous comment. The 'submitting' status is not a problem so long as we know that the downstream system did in fact receive notification of these transactions.

item.title: [SS-1103] Statistics on Team view are wrong
item.description: The statistics on supervisor's team view are wrong. When a supervisor looks at the team view, it shows that a certain examiner has 366 open activities. When I sign on as that examiner, she has 625 open actitivies. I ran maintenance_tools.bat to refresh the dbstatistics and statistics, but that didn't fix our problem. What do I need to run to get this corrected?
item.summary: Statistics on Team view are wrong
item.comment: the user was in multiple groups. I'm in the process of wrting some sql updates to reassign the activity.assignedgroupid to be the claim.assignedgroupid for these activities.

item.title: [SS-1058] SQL Optimization for ClaimCenter 2.15
item.description: From: Adrian Brown [mailto:Adrian.Brown@canal-ins.com] Cc: Wanda Toler; Patrick Lee; Pramoda Vallabhaneni; Mike Kayse Subject: SQL Optimization for ClaimCenter 2.15 After two plus years on ClaimCenter we are noticing a slower response time which could be from a variety of causes. Is there any recommended re-indexing or job to be run that you can suggest for ClaimCenter itself?
item.comment: To: 'Adrian Brown' Cc: Wanda Toler; Patrick Lee; Pramoda Vallabhaneni; Mike Kayse Hi Adrian, The attached document [http://svn/svn/Services/Documentation/Infrastructure/Performance/Guidewire-Performance-Guidelines.pdf] provides some guidelines and suggestions for configuring the database. We don't have many specifics regarding MS SQL Server. I may be able to provide more detail if you can provide more specifics.
item.current-status: Cust to provide more specifics regarding slow performance

item.title: [SS-1082] Level 1,2,3 in claimcenter for experience
item.description: From: Mike Kayse [mailto:Mike.Kayse@canal-ins.com] Sent: Tuesday, December 05, 2006 13:53 Paul, I was requested to do a spread sheet for Claims with a breakdown by experience levels, for instance, senior level, mid-level, and associate claims. Basically this can be found in the administration menu with the teams. The breakdown is Management team 1 then claims team A then Auto Team A Level 1,2,3. What table(s) do I find the level breakdowns in because I need to assign this to each supervisor? thanks.
item.current-status: Cust wants to roll up the values for reporting purposes. He thinks he's on the right track, though, so the ball is currently in his court.

item.title: [SS-1033] Automate in-house legal billing
item.description: From: Pemelton, Sara [mailto:spemelton@employersdirect.com] Sent: Monday, October 30, 2006 16:07 To: Paul Schaaf Hi Paul. Hope you had a good weekend. I briefly asked you this question in Friday's meeting, but here are more details. We need to automate legal clearing (in-house legal billing...when a member of the EDIC legal department is representing the client on a claim at the WCAB). In order to do this we need to trigger ClaimCenter to create a manual payment transaction that bills the file for our legal services. I'm assuming this is possible as CC creates other transaction in various integrations and internally with various triggers. Do you have any documentation our developers can refer to build this mechanism? If I remember right, 4.0 was slated to have this type of functionality. Thanks Paul.
item.comment: Sent: Friday, December 15, 2006 12:01 To: 'Pemelton, Sara'; Cecil, Carl; OBrien, Janis Sara, [...] SS-1033 / EDIC 375: Automate in-house legal billing You should be able to implement this in rules. You can create a check using the GScript function "Exposure.createCheck()". [...]
item.current-status: Confirm with cust that this answers their question

item.title: [SS-1036] Rules create indemnity exposure in draft mode and do not assign to Claim owner
item.description: Hi Paul...this was caught during UAT of 3.12, prior to implementation. It was a fix to the OOB that was scheduled in 4.0. Unfortunately we're not taking 4.0 in the immediately future and this is causing grief with our policy holders. I'm hoping that GW has identified the cause and can help us with the fix. Our rules trigger the Indemnity feature to open automatically. When it's opened this way, the feature (exposure) is in DRAFT status and not assigned to the claim owner. This has no affect until the claim is closed. When the claim closes, our rules automatically reduce reserves and close all open features. If the indemnity feature is in DRAFT status, the feature will not close, leaving remaining reserves on closed claims. Our customers are not happy about this. Can you tell us what triggers the exposure to come out of DRAFT status (it passes all validation levels, is assigned, etc, but is stuck in draft) and what any known fix is for this? Thanks for your input. Sara Pemelton
item.summary: Rules create indemnity exposure in draft mode and do not assign to Claim owner
item.comment: Waiting on response from cust. It is not clear whether segmentation rules can be triggered from other rules (I believe that segment() just sets the segment, it does not fire the ruleset). Cust's response will determine the workaround we recommend. See related CC for the details.
item.current-status: Waiting on Cust. Their response will determine the workaround we recommend.

item.title: [SS-1079] EDIC snapshot has many errors
item.description: Carl, We're trying to get a copy of your app working here, based upon the files you sent us before Thanksgiving, but there are many errors that prevent us from starting it. (I've filed this as issue SS-1079) For instance, many display keys are missing: 2006-12-01 19:59:56,617 ERROR Element NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor.Company.Vendortype in NameValueView ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor refers to a property key, NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor.Company.Vendortype, that doesn't exist 2006-12-01 19:59:56,617 ERROR Element NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor.Company.VendorNumber in NameValueView ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor refers to a property key, NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor.Company.VendorNumber, that doesn't exist 2006-12-01 19:59:56,617 ERROR Element NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor.Company.Preferred in NameValueView ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor refers to a property key, NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor.Company.Preferred, that doesn't exist 2006-12-01 19:59:56,617 ERROR Element NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor.Other in NameValueView ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor refers to a property key, NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedPersonVendor.Other, that doesn't exist 2006-12-01 19:59:56,617 ERROR Element NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedCompanyVendor.Company.Vendortype in NameValueView ClaimPartyInvolvedCompanyVendor refers to a property key, NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedCompanyVendor.Company.Vendortype, that doesn't exist 2006-12-01 19:59:56,617 ERROR Element NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedCompanyVendor.Company.VendorNumber in NameValueView ClaimPartyInvolvedCompanyVendor refers to a property key, NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedCompanyVendor.Company.VendorNumber, that doesn't exist 2006-12-01 19:59:56,617 ERROR Element NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedCompanyVendor.Company.Preferred in NameValueView ClaimPartyInvolvedCompanyVendor refers to a property key, NVV.Addressbook.ClaimPartyInvolvedCompanyVendor.Company.Preferred, that doesn't exist Do these keys exist in your installation?
item.comment: I found two things incorrect with customer's client/config-env 1) The changes are made in file inside folder config/locale , which isn't correct one, the correct folder is config/display. 2) display properties should be defined in displayext.properties and not in display.properties. I will communicate the above observations to customer and after the configuration is corrected we can try rebuilding the war and deploying it.
item.current-status: Support found two things incorrect with customer's client/config-env 1) The changes are made in file inside folder config/locale , which isn't correct one, the correct folder is config/display. 2) display properties should be defined in displayext.properties and not in display.properties. Customer has been asked to correct the above observations. Waiting for response from customer.

item.title: [SS-1005] Withholding on vendors in ClaimCenter
item.description: From: Pemelton, Sara [mailto:spemelton@employersdirect.com] Sent: Thursday, October 05, 2006 14:10 Cc: Cecil, Carl; Thorsen, Kerstin; OBrien, Janis Hi Paul. Can you answer my question below? Thanks. Sara Pemelton -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From: Cecil, Carl Sent: Thursday, October 05, 2006 1:24 PM To: Pemelton, Sara Cc: OBrien, Janis; Thorsen, Kerstin Subject: RE: WITHHOLDING ON VENDORS IN CLAIMCENTER This is a question for GW Support. I can't find anything on it. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From: Pemelton, Sara Sent: Wednesday, October 04, 2006 2:44 PM To: Cecil, Carl Cc: OBrien, Janis; Thorsen, Kerstin Subject: WITHHOLDING ON VENDORS IN CLAIMCENTER Can you tell me what triggers CC to set the withholdings automatically? I thought it was the W9 & Tax info, but apparently not. We had a large increase in the number of withholdings this month, and I cannot figure out why it's taking the deduction on these as the AB record has all the required IRS/Tax info. Thanks Carl. EXAMPLE: TIN # 95-6002748 AB record:
item.comment: ________________________________________ From: Pemelton, Sara [mailto:spemelton@employersdirect.com] Sent: Friday, December 15, 2006 5:13 PM To: Glen Goon Subject: RE: SS-1005 - Withholding on vendors in ClaimCenter Haven't gotten to this one yet Glen. We're doing a rush update release for all the 2007 rate changes effective 1/1 so that's taken priority. It's next. Thanks for checking in! Sara Pemelton Sr. Claims System Manager 818-575-8500 (Main) 818-597-7415 (Direct) 562-254-2981 (Cell) 562-685-0266 (Fax)   ________________________________________ From: Glen Goon [mailto:ggoon@guidewire.com] Sent: Friday, December 15, 2006 4:33 PM To: Pemelton, Sara Subject: FW: SS-1005 - Withholding on vendors in ClaimCenter Hi Sara, I'm checking in to see if this is still an issue? Have you been able to check to see if there is a rule that might be setting the withholding or what the TaxStatus is set to for this vendor? Thanks, Glen
item.current-status: For the vendor in question, waiting for EDIC to check what the cc_contact.TaxStatus is and if in their config the status is somehow being set automatically.

item.title: [FFS-3684] Extend search configuration to allow adding new required search fields
item.description: Allow claim searching to be configured to add new required fields. Use Case: Due to their legacy systems having duplicate Claim Numbers, Hanover will be converting their legacy claim numbers into an extension field and will need to search on this extension field since all prior communications to the customer has been done through this legacy claim number and not the new unique ClaimCenter claim number. Additionally, they have a use case to search by license plate, which is currently not a required search field.
item.summary: Extend search configuration to allow adding new required search fields
item.comment: Did this cc-support response answer this question? --- Daniel,   Yes it applies in Athena. You cannot add a required parameter and you should not modify the exist ones. (This is noted in the Config guide and in the search-config.xml file itself.) You can review the section called Customizing Search Screens in the config guide. This section was reviewed by Engineering before it went to "press."   The ContactCenter chapter has an example of adding a search criteria also if you want to check your process.   Mary -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- From: cc-support-bounces@guidewire.com [mailto:cc-support-bounces@guidewire.com] On Behalf Of Daniel Wang Sent: Tuesday, January 02, 2007 11:04 AM To: cc-support Subject: [Cc-support] Configuring Claim Search According to the search-configuration spec on the Wiki (http://wiki/index.php/Search_Configuration_Spec), it says that we can't add new required fields to the search. Does this still apply in Athena? (We've tried adding a new search parameter, and we couldn't search on that configured field alone.) If anyone knows, that would be very helpful. Thanks in advance for the help.   Regards, Dan

item.current-status: Mark to use Derek's suggestions to implement a workaround. Still getting errors on page.

item.title: [FFS-3699] MSA Response Time issues - Clarification of questions on CC Documents
item.description: I have been asked to verify that the use of the local temp folder (see attached Word document) is limited to document creation in ClaimCenter. Another question we need answered is the Plugin ActiveX Control "TemplateRunner".. Is that resident in memory for a user's session or does it need to be invoked every time a document is created?
item.summary: MSA Response Time issues - Clarification of questions on CC Documents
item.comment: The temp folder is also used for displaying the document contents when the "TemplateRunner" is enabled. I'm not sure what the second question is getting at. Is the question about memory usage? In 3.1.X the ActiveX control is referenced from the page which uses it, which is therefore reloaded when the page is refreshed. There is not a single instance which persists across the user's session, since it exists on the browser side.

item.title: [FFS-3700] CheckIssued event not being generated for manual check requiring approval
item.description: If a manual check requires approval, after the approval is entered the manual check goes into a notifying status without a CheckIssued event being generated. This is causing payments to be bypassed in the downstream systems. I should note that this is not a problem unless the manual check does requires approval. If no approval required, the CheckIssued event is generated when the manual check goes into notifying status.
item.summary: CheckIssued event not being generated for manual check requiring approval
item.comment: Sounds like a bug, I think. If we are generating a CheckIssued event for manual checks when they don't require approval, but aren't generating one when they do require approval, that's a bug.

item.title: [FFS-3674] java.io.NotSerializableException: com.guidewire.pl.web.widget.WebMessage
item.description: When running the policy search via the soap plugin, the console and log is filled with exceptions about serialization of web messages. see attached log file. the application seems to function normally.
